DOC.brief_title: Telehealth Weight Maintenance African-American Women ( `` Exercise Your Faith '' )
DOC.detailed_description: Rates obesity United States increase dramatically past four decade . Although research study demonstrate weight loss achievable lifestyle modification , maintenance weight reduction beyond six month remain challenge . This study examine feasibility telehealth program weight maintenance . Telehealth delivery health relate service promote healthy behavior innovative use technology , without need travel . The telehealth program accessible home Internet-enabled television set . The telehealth program include three component : ( 1 ) weekly video program discuss problem solve relapse prevention strategy include motivational story ; ( 2 ) regularly update video exercise program ; ( 3 ) online communication study participant exercise nutrition specialist . A randomized control trial determine feasibility acceptability weight maintenance telehealth program . The study participant African-American woman , high prevalence obesity disproportionate risk relate chronic disease ( e.g. , diabetes ) . Two church collaborate University Illinois Chicago assist meeting social , spiritual , cultural need participant . One hundred woman recruit participate one-year trial . The study include weight loss phase ( Phase 1 ) , weight maintenance phase ( Phase 2 ) . During Phase 1 , participant attend 12-week weight loss program hold participate church . Following completion program , one church assign intervention group , church comparison group . During Phase 2 , participant intervention group receive monthly telephone counsel plus access telehealth program , comparison group receive monthly telephone counseling . The specific aim study include : ( 1 ) evaluate effect telehealth program change body mass index ; ( 2 ) evaluate effect telehealth program physical activity fat , fiber , fruit vegetable intake .
